articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-reunification Patriot
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-reunification Patriot
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to indomitable pro-reunification patriot Kim Yong Dal on Tuesday, his 80th birthday. 
					 Born in a poor peasant family before the country's liberation, Kim Yong Dal joined the Korean People's Army during the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War. He bravely fought for the victory in the war in hearty response to the order of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He was arrested by the enemy while waging a sacred struggle for national reunification in the post-war period. He remained true to his revolutionary faith and principles despite all sorts of sufferings behind bars for decades. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il saw to it that he was brought back to the DPRK. He showed all sorts of loving care for him, projecting him as hero of the Republic and recipient of the National Reunification Prize.

articles.title: Greetings to Namibian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian President 
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of its independence. 
					 Kim Yong Nam expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing the president and people of Namibia bigger successes in their efforts for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pukchang Thermal-power Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pukchang Thermal-power Complex
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Pukchang Thermal-power Complex.
					 The premier looked round various places of the complex and held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed measures for the complex to increase power production by meticulously organizing technical control and equipment management and for related units to ensure raw and other materials.
					
					 Then followed a consultative meeting to fully provide the complex with coal. It stressed the need for the coal industrial sector to contribute to increasing power production by carrying out the monthly and quarterly production plans without fail.
					
					 Earlier, the premier made a field survey of the Chollima Steel Complex.
					
					 He learned about the operation of 6 000-ton press and looked round the production processes of the steel shop before holding a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting took measures to substantially produce iron and steel needed for economic construction and improvement of the people's living standard and discussed supplying raw and other materials in time at related units.

articles.title: FM Pak Ui Chun Sends Congratulatory Message to His Nigerian Counterpart
articles.content:
FM Pak Ui Chun Sends Congratulatory Message to His Nigerian Counterpart 
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a congratulatory message to Aminu Wali on his appointment as foreign minister of Nigeria. 
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in the common interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on March 14 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					 Among those present on invitation were officials of the government, political parties, organs and organizations of Russia.
					
					 They included Vice Foreign Minister of Russia Igor Morgulov, a vice-minister of Far Eastern Regional Development, the chairman of the Russia－DPRK Friendship Parliamentary Group of the State Duma and  those of the State Duma, Russian Federal Council, United Russia Party, Communist Party of the Russian Federation, "A Just Russia", Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, Ministry of Economy and Development, Ministry of Regional Development, Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Education and Science, Ministry of Culture, Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Russia, "Russian Railways" Company, "Mostovik" Scientific-industrial Company of Russia, Institute of the Far East, Russian news agency Ria－Novosti and the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, and his embassy staff members.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before a full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round photos on display on the theme of "Holding high the banner of Songun".
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Performances of Art Squads of KPA Units Go On
articles.content:
Performances of Art Squads of KPA Units Go On
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The art squads of the units of the Korean People's Army that proved successful at the 1st contest among art squads of the KPA gave more performances here. 
					Service personnel of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces watched the performances given on Sunday and Monday. 
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including chorus "Might of Korea", female quartet "Our dear supreme commander" and real story-telling "Great comrade-in-arms". 
					
					 The performers made an impressive artistic representation of the service personnel dynamically advancing for the final victory under the steersmanship of the supreme commander of the KPA, who is successfully carrying forward the Juche revolutionary cause. 
					
					 They truthfully reflected the strong will of the powerful revolutionary army of Kim Jong Un to dynamically advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, united close around the supreme commander.

articles.title: Collection of Revolutionary Anecdotes Published
articles.content:
Collection of Revolutionary Anecdotes Published
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Vol. 1 of "Collection of Kim Il Sung's Anecdotes", a cycle of revolutionary anecdotes, was published in the DPRK.
					 The cycle records in serial volumes many revolutionary anecdotes which deal with the more than eight decades-long glorious revolutionary life of President Kim Il Sung in a chronological order.
					
					 The anecdotes were written on the basis of the President's reminiscences about his career, leader Kim Jong Il's recollection of the President and the reminiscences given by family members and those persons who witnessed the revolutionary activities of the President.
					
					 They also include stories which serve as references for understanding revolutionary anecdotes.
					
					 Vol. 1 has four chapters dealing with the revolutionary anecdotes of the President's childhood from April, Juche 1 (1912) to June, Juche 15 (1926).
					
					 The first chapter "Childhood" deals with anecdotes related to the birth of the President and those anecdotes telling about how he showed distinguished natural talents, spending his childhood in a patriotic and revolutionary family generation after generation.
					
					 The second chapter "In a Foreign Land" contains anecdotes about the facts that the President left the country and lived in Linjiang and Badaogou.
					
					 The third chapter "Days at Changdok School" deals with anecdotes telling about the historical facts that the President came to Mangyongdae, his birthplace, by covering the 250 mile journey for learning at the age of 12 and covered the same long  journey for national liberation with the firm pledge never to return home unless he liberates the country.
					
					 The fourth chapter "In Fusong" records some of many stories telling the fact that the President earned his fame as a young political activist in his days at Fusong Primary School No. 1.
					
					 It also deals with stories that the President carried forward the idea of Aim High, the idea of being prepared for three contingencies, the idea of recruiting comrades and two pistols as the precious heritage from his father  and that he hardened his will to devote all his efforts to achieving the historic cause of the country's liberation.

articles.title: Cold Humid Land Improved in DPRK
articles.content:
Cold Humid Land Improved in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Agricultural officials and workers of the DPRK direct big efforts to improving cold humid land to raise this year's grain yield.
					 According to data available, more than 40 000 hectares of cold humid land have been improved throughout the country up to now.
					
					 20 000 hectares were improved in South Hwanghae Province, 7 000 in North Hwanghae Province and 6 000 in North Phyongan Province.
					
					 Kangwon Province and Nampho City carried out their cold humid land improvement assignments for this year ahead of schedule and South Hamgyong Province finished its plan in the main despite of difficult conditions.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway Management Station is keeping more than 20 reservoirs filled with water for the year's farming.

articles.title: Sandy Dust Phenomenon Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Sandy Dust Phenomenon Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Sandy dust swept over the northern inland areas and other parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from Monday night to Tuesday morning.
					 The dust originated in the Great Gobi and the Inner Mongolian areas of China Sunday, due to the atmospheric low pressure and then high-level anticyclone from central Mongolia.
					
					 It moved to the DPRK areas through the northwest air stream in a high atmospheric layer, but its influence was very weak as it was accompanied by soft rain.

articles.title: Contest of Traditional Dishes in Kaesong Area of DPRK
articles.content:
Contest of Traditional Dishes in Kaesong Area of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Kaesong area in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea boasts of a number of traditional dishes peculiar to the area.
					 Some days ago, a traditional dish contest took place at the Thongil Restaurant in Kaesong City, with the attendance of cooks from restaurants and hotel in the city.
					
					 What was eye-catching in the contest was bouilli chicken cooked with Kaesong Insam (ginseng), glutinous rice, jujube and chestnut, presented by the Thongil Restaurant.
					
					 Fruit punch, mixed with dried persimmon, ginger, cinnamon and honey, presented by the Kaesong Folk Hotel, was also popular among competitors.
					
					 Chicken soup boiled with ginseng and mudfish soup, which were presented by the restaurants under the City Public Catering Management Office, were also highly appreciated.
					
					 The contest served as a good occasion for further developing traditional Korean dishes.

articles.title: New Sleeve Bearing Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Sleeve Bearing Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Ferrous Metal Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has developed a new kind of sleeve bearing made of aluminium alloy, instead of copper and tin alloys and lead.
					 The institute succeeded in inventing a new kind of aluminium alloy material to be used in making various sizes of sleeve bearings.
					
					 Mechanical indices of an aluminium-alloy sleeve bearing are higher than those of sleeve bearings made of copper alloy and babbit, with its durability two to three times longer than the existing ones.
					
					 The new kind of bearing can be used effectively in crushers, presses, cranes and others. It was registered as one of the national inventions.

articles.title: First Round of Premier Soccer League Matches Goes On
articles.content:
First Round of Premier Soccer League Matches Goes On
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The first round of the premier soccer league matches is now under way amid deep interest of sportspersons and fans. 
					 As of now, the April 25 Team, Rimyongsu Team and Mangyongbong Team are proving successful in men's matches. 
					
					 On Tuesday the Ryongaksan Team beat the Kwanmobong Team 3:0 and the Amnokgang Team trounced the Myohyangsan Team 1:0 while the Kigwancha Team and Light Industry Ministry Team drew 2:2 in men's matches. 
					
					 In women's matches the Ryongaksan Team defeated the Sinhungsan Team 3:0, the Mangyongbong Team beat the Myohyangsan Team 1:0 and the Rimyongsu Team trounced the Kalmaegi Team 1:0. 
					
					 The matches go on.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Strengthening Role of County
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Strengthening Role of County
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an editorial calls for giving greater spurs to the work for strengthening the role of the county. 
					 In the DPRK, county is a base for carrying out the three resolutions -- ideological, technical and cultural -- and a main unit of general offensive to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il published the work "The Position and Role of a County in Socialist Construction" five decades ago, indicating a wide avenue for bringing about a great surge in the socialist construction.
					
					 The editorial says:
					
					  Strengthening the county and its role is to dynamically promote the building of the thriving nation and enable the people to live in luxury and comfort under socialism as early as possible.
					
					 To strengthen the role of the county is a basic requirement for bringing about a leap forward in the agricultural production to firmly defend Korean-style socialism and translate the idea of building a highly civilized socialist country into a reality.
					
					 Only when all the counties do farming well to achieve a leap forward in the agricultural production, will our advance make faster progress and loud cheers for socialism and the WPK will ring out throughout the country.
					
					 In the civilized socialist country now being built the people will fully enjoy a highly civilized life with rapidly developed cultural standard and ample living conditions provided in all fabrics of social life and all the regions of the country. 
					
					  When all counties build a factory and a dwelling house, they should construct them in such a way as to be suited to their local features and meet the need of socialism and enable people to substantially benefit from them. This is an important requirement of our party for the building of a highly civilized nation.
					
					 Only when all counties carry on a dynamic struggle upholding the party's idea of building the highly civilized country, will the country greet the period of efflorescence of a high level of civilization to be envied by world people.

articles.title: Minju Joson Terms U.S. Talk about "Denuclearization" Hypocritical
articles.content:
Minju Joson Terms U.S. Talk about "Denuclearization" Hypocritical 
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently carried out the test of a new-type nuclear bomb, an improved version of B-61 in New Mexico State, according to foreign press reports.
					 This bomb is to be reportedly deployed in various NATO member nations in Europe in the future.
					
					 This stands in sharp contrast to U.S. President Obama's idea of building a "world without nuclear weapons", says Minju Joson Tuesday in an article.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to hold an unchallenged edge in the field of strategic nuclear force and thus realize its ambition for world supremacy by relying on it. The U.S. regards it as a top priority task to cut down and adjust the existing nuclear force to this end, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S., therefore, is going over to a more efficient system for maintenance and management of nuclear force as it makes it possible to significantly raise the operational capabilities by preferring the improvement of the quality of the nuclear force to its quantity and by improving its performance.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the U.S. seeks to craftily veil the change in its nuclear policy with the "will for denuclearization" and weaken the nuclear operational capabilities of other countries.
					
					 The U.S. moves to manufacture more modern nuclear weapons and proliferate them to different parts of the world are an unethical act of plunging the world into the whirlwind of the Cold War again and sparking a nuclear arms race.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that those countries exposed to the grave strategic threat of the U.S. will opt for bolstering nuclear force to cope with it.
					
					 No one can say that this will not lead to the horrible tragedy called conflict of nuclear force.
					
					 The U.S. should stop at once the dangerous military act of threatening the existence of mankind.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Slammed for Denying Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Slammed for Denying Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A vice-minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan recently denied the Kono statement which admitted the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. At a meeting, urging the reexamination of the Kono statement the vice-minister said he shared the view with the rhetoric of ultra-rightists and he would fervently support them.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a brigandish behavior to conceal Japan's history of aggression and hideous crimes against humanity.
					
					 It is the contention of the present Japanese authorities that if they admit the Kono statement, it would mean admitting by themselves the Japanese imperialists' history of aggression and hideous crimes against humanity and, consequently, they would lose any justification for their persistent negation and distortion of history and moves for reinvasion.
					
					 That was the reason why the vice-minister let loose a spate of outbursts denying the Kono statement.
					
					 Great irony is that the Japanese reactionaries are making poor excuses in a bid to calm down the rebuff of the international community while working hard to reduce the Kono statement to a dead paper.
					
					 The situation goes to clearly show how desperately the Japanese reactionaries are trying to turn back the wheel of history.
					
					 But with no efforts to put the hands of a clock back, can they stem the trend of history and with no rhetoric can they justify their crime-woven history. 
					
					 If Japan does not want to be pushed to the margin of history, it should reflect on itself honestly in face of all truth about the past.

articles.title: Japan's Sexual Slavery Forced in Organized Way: News Analysis
articles.content:
Japan's Sexual Slavery Forced in Organized Way: News Analysis
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces' documents showing the facts of the sexual slavery forced by the Imperial Japanese Army were declassified and opened to public some days ago.  
					 According to the documents, which carry testimonies of a Japanese soldier who was taken a POW in Myanmar in April 1945, Japan set up comfort stations in the army units for sexual slavery. They also quoted a Chinese woman nurse as saying that a medical officer of the Japanese Ground Force visited a station in Manchuria every Friday for a regular medical check-up and the station housed 150 women, including 130 Koreans, and all of them were suffering from venereal disease.
					
					 The documents go to prove that the Imperial Japanese Army was directly and systematically involved in the sexual slavery, considering the abducted women to be munitions.
					
					 As seen above, the sexual slavery by the Japanese imperialists was an extra-large inhumane crime committed with the Japanese government and military involved. 
					
					 So, the 1993 Kono's statement, prompted by the sense of guilt, admitted the crime. The United States, the master of Japan, too, imposed a ban on entry into the U.S. territory against 16 Japanese war criminals related to the sexual slavery in December 1996, and the ban has taken effective still now.
					
					 However, the right-wing forces of Japan still deny the existence of the sexual slavery system. 
					
					 In particular, the present Japanese government has called for re-examination or verification of Kono's statement, arguing that "comfort women issue is faked-up one" and "government's direct involvement should not be admitted".
					
					 The argument is tantamount to intolerable challenge to and mockery of the international community pressing Japan to make apology and reparation for the crime.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' denial of the sexual slavery reveals their attempt to flee from responsibilities for the crimes and represents their revanchist ambition for re-invasion.
					
					 If Japan, seized with wild dream, persists in its move to justify the past crimes despite of the warning of the international community, the consequences would be really miserable.
					
					 The persistence will only bring bigger shame to Japan than what it suffered at a UN Human Rights Council session in Geneva.

articles.title: Documents Exposing Inside Stories about Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Disclosed
articles.content:
Documents Exposing Inside Stories about Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Disclosed
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Yonhap News of south Korea on Mar. 16 obtained from the U.S. forces two documents proving that sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army was enforced in an organized manner and opened them to public.
					 One of them is a document recording the contents of the interrogation made of a soldier of the Imperial Japanese Army after he was arrested in Burma (Myanmar) in April, 1945.
					
					 According to it, it was disclosed in the course of the interrogation that the Imperial Japanese Army set up "comfort stations" in different parts of that country and operated them.
					
					 Another document worked out by a major of the U.S. forces stationed in Kunming, China on May 13, 1945 said that in those days a medical officer of the Japanese Ground Force visited a "comfort station" in Manchuria on every Friday for a regular medical check-up.
					
					According to it, this "comfort station" housed 150 women including 130 Korean women at that time and all of them were suffering from a venereal disease. 
					
					 The two documents confirm that many women were forced into sexual slavery in various areas occupied by Japanese troops and they were under systematic control by medical officers of Japan, the news added.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pursuing Sham Politics
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pursuing Sham Politics
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The representative of the opposition Democratic Party of south Korea accused the present chief executive and the "Saenuri Party" of having pursued sham politics all the year round, according to KBS of south Korea on Mar. 14.
					 At the meeting of leading members of the party that day, the representative said that the present regime reneged on all its commitments to people's living one after another including the introduction of basic pension system, adding that the highest rate of young joblessness, in particular,  is the result of the appalling  part-time jobs produced by the regime.

articles.title: Damage Caused by Bird Flu Expands in S. Korea
articles.content:
Damage Caused by Bird Flu Expands in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Damage caused by bird flu is expanding in south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Bird flu has spread to 34 areas since it broke out for the first time in mid-January this year, causing big damage to at least 410 farmhouses.

articles.title: Korean Artiste in U.S. Praises Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean Artiste in U.S. Praises Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- An article written by the head of the Uruk Symphony Orchestra, art troupe of Koreans in the U.S., was posted on Minjok Thongsin, internet paper of Koreans in the U.S. 
					 The working masses of the DPRK ardently sing the song "February is spring", the article said, and went on:
					
					 The song expresses belief that future of Korea is always bright and rosy thanks to February in spring when Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK, was born. 
					
					 The DPRK has drawn worldwide attention since President Kim Il Sung passed away. 
					
					 Can the DPRK stand unfazed by the U.S. moves to stifle it? Through media the enemies spread the rumor about "collapse" of the DPRK, claiming it was an established fact. 
					
					 It was against this backdrop that NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il visited the Tabaksol Post (post under young pine trees) on the morning of the New Year 1995 before any other places. 
					
					 His field guidance was given to one post on the front to another without let-up despite snowstorm and sweltering mid-summer days. 
					
					 The service personnel and people of the north always remember the devoted services Kim Jong Il rendered by turning the country into a strong military power under the banner of Songun. 
					
					 The day of national reunification desired by Kim Jong Il is approaching in the era of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The world came to know about the invincible might of the DPRK, in which the leader and the people are single-mindedly united. 
					
					 World people praise Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is providing field guidance day and night for the happiness of the working masses, as sun and benefactor.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech Introduced in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech Introduced in Switzerland 
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The full text of "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive!", the speech made by Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea, was posted by the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland on their internet websites on March 1.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Congratulate Kim Jong Un on His Election as Deputy to SPA
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Congratulate Kim Jong Un on His Election as Deputy to SPA 
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland posted an article congratulating supreme leader Kim Jong Un on his election as deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK on their websites on March 12. 
					 The article said that Kim Jong Un's election as deputy to the 13th SPA was an expression of all the service personnel and people's absolute support and deep trust in him as they are firmly determined to remain loyal to him. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un has pursued the politics of love for the people, carrying forward President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's idea of believing in people as in Heaven. 
					
					 Under his Songun leadership the DPRK has achieved great progress in the building of an economic power. 
					
					 The DPRK will glorify its dignity as Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea thanks to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Ulyanovsk Region of Russia on Mar. 11.
					 Aleksandr Kruglikov, chairman of the "Jongilbong" Russia-Korea Friendship Association of Ulyanovsk Region, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee fixed the period from Mar. 11 to April 20 as a celebration period and decided to arrange diverse political and cultural events praising the undying feats of the President during the period.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Czech Republic
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A Czech preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) was formed in Prague on Mar. 5.
					 Jaroslav Kafka, chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 It decided to arrange diverse political and cultural events praising the undying revolutionary feats of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Annual General Meeting of Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held
articles.content:
Annual General Meeting of Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held
						
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- There took place in Havana on Feb. 28 an annual general meeting of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification.
					 Present at the meeting were Oberto Santin Caserez, president of the committee, Alicia Corredera, vice-president of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK charge d'affaires ad interim and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work of the committee last year and discussed the plan for work this year.
					
					 The speakers at the meeting underlined the need to widely introduce the New Year Address of supreme leader Kim Jong Un and conduct brisk solidarity activities to support the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Foreign Media Give Wide Publicity to Statement of NDC
articles.content:
Foreign Media Give Wide Publicity to Statement of NDC 
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign media gave wide publicity to the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK on March 15.
					 The Chinese News Service said that the NDC of the DPRK issued a statement to cope with the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The NDC said in the statement that the U.S. would be well advised to lift by itself all the unjust measures in all fields before facing the disastrous consequences to be entailed by its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The NDC of the DPRK clarifies its principled stand on the U.S. hostile policy toward it at home and abroad, the statement said, and referred to its contents in detail.
					
					 The statement said that the U.S. had better roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK as soon as possible and shape a new realistic policy before it is too late. This would be beneficial not only to meeting the U.S. interests but also to ensuring the security of its mainland.
					
					 Other foreign media also reported the statement of the NDC of the DRPK.
					
					 They included the Xinhua News Agency and the Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings LTD., Hong Kong and the Hong Kong newspaper South China Morning Post of China, ITAR－TASS of Russia, Fars News Agency, Press TV Broadcasting and Radio Broadcasting Services of Iran, an Italian internet news service, C. Equis 36 Radio Centenario of Uruguay, Kyodo News of Japan and internet homepages of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK and Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Revelados nuevos datos sobre esclavitud sexual establecida por viejo ejercito japones
articles.content:
Revelados nuevos datos sobre esclavitud sexual establecida por viejo ejercito japones
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ACNC) -- Se dieron a la publicidad los recien desclasificados documentos de las tropas norteamericanas que delatan el crimen de esclavitud sexual cometido en el siglo pasado por el viejo ejercito japones.
					Segun ellos, un militar japones apresado en abril de 1945 en Myanmar confeso durante el proceso de interrogacion que el imperialismo japones tenia en sus tropas los establecimientos donde se obligaba a las mujeres inocentes la vida de esclava sexual. Una  enfermera china declaro que un medico militar de las fuerzas terrestres japonesas realizaba cada viernes el chequeo medico en las instalaciones de esclavitud sexual en Manchuria. Anadio que por culpa de los satiros japoneses, todas 150 mujeres retenidas alli, inclusive 130 coreanas, cogieron enfermedades venereas.
					
					Los documentos testimonian que en el pasado, las tropas japonesas administraban directa y sistematicamente a las mujeres secuestradas considerandolas como materiales de logistica y obligandoles una vida sexual asquerosa.
					
					Asi el caso de esclavitud sexual deviene archicrimen antietico cometido organizada y forzosamente bajo la participacion del gobierno y el circulo militar.
					
					La declaracion de Kono de 1993 lo reconocio aceptando la opinion publica internacional y sintiendo la culpabilidad. 
					
					Por este hecho historico ineludible e inocultable, hasta EE.UU., amo de Japon, prohibio en diciembre de 1996 entrar en su pais a 16 criminales japoneses de guerra involucrados en dicho crimen y mantiene esta medida hasta la fecha.
					
					A pesar de esto, las fuerzas derechistas japonesas siguen negando la existencia del regimen de esclavitud sexual.    
					
					En particular, bajo el actual gobierno insisten en revisar la declaracion de Kono y verificar el caso diciendo que el "problema de consoladoras sexuales es un hecho inventado" y "no se debe reconocer la intervencion directa del gobierno".
					
					Todo esto constituye un desafio y burla intolerables a la sociedad internacional que  lo condena y urge a Japon pedir disculpas e indemnizar por el respecto.
					
					La negativa de los reaccionarios japoneses es  una expresion coherente de su ambicion de liberarse de la responsabilidad de los crimenes del pasado y lanzar la reagresion revanchista para repetir a toda costa tales actos horribles. 
					
					Japon suena con lo irrealizable. Si sigue tratando de justificar sus crimenes del pasado desoyendo la advertencia de la sociedad internacional, ese pais tendra consecuencias catastroficas.
					
					Ademas, pasara la verguenza mucho mas grande que la sufrida en la reunion del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU sesionada en Ginebra.

articles.title: Mejoradas en RPDC mas de 40 mil hectareas de tierra fria y humeda
articles.content:
Mejoradas en RPDC mas de 40 mil hectareas de tierra fria y humeda
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ACNC) -- Los funcionarios y los trabajadores de la rama agricola de Corea se esfuerzan por mejorar la calidad de la tierra fria y humeda para cumplir el plan de produccion cerealista de este ano.
					Segun las estadisticas recogidas, desde el inicio de los preparativos agricolas hasta la fecha, fueron optimizadas mas de 40 mil hectareas de tierra fria y humeda, de ellas mas de 20 mil de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur y mas de 7 mil de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					
					En la provincia de Kangwon ya se cumplio en corto plazo el plan de mejoramiento de los terrenos de ese tipo.
					
					En las zonas rurales de la ciudad de Nampho fue terminada la misma tarea con mucho adelanto que el ano pasado.
					
					A pesar de las condiciones desfavorables,  en varias ciudades y distritos de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur se llevo a cabo el mejoramiento y lo impulsan en etapa final otros distritos.
					
					En las granjas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte fueron roturadas mas de 6 mil hectareas segun la norma tecnica.
					
					Por otra parte, la empresa de mantenimiento del canal de riego Kaechon-lago Thaesong retuvo el agua en mas de 20 represas dando la garantia del exito de la agricultura de este ano.

articles.title: Inventado en RPDC nuevo tipo de cojinete de manga
articles.content:
Inventado en RPDC nuevo tipo de cojinete de manga 
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Instituto de Metales Ferrosos de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de Corea invento el cojinete de manga hecho con la aleacion de aluminio.
					Anteriormente, no se pudo cubrir las demandas sobre el cojinete de manga porque se hacia con las aleaciones costosas como la de cobre y la de plomo y estano.
					
					El equipo de investigadores invento nuevo material de aleacion de aluminio que permite garantizar la maxima utilidad en la produccion de ese articulo y asentarla sobre la base cientifica.
					
					Igualmente, resolvio los problemas cientifico-tecnicos surgidos en la produccion y aplicacion de los cojinetes de manga de diferentes formas y tamanos.
					
					En comparacion con los cojinetes hechos con la aleacion de cobre y babbit, el nuevo invento mostro mejores indicadores mecanicos en la resistencia de traccion, la tasa de extension y el coeficiente de rozamiento y tiene una duracion doble y hasta triple.
					
					Se recomienda usarlo en la trituradora de varios tipos, la quebradora, la prensa, la grua, etc.
					
					El nuevo cojinete fue registrado como invencion estatal.
					
					Ahora se emplea ampliamente en las maquinas y equipos giratorios de la fabrica metalurgica y otras unidades y en la produccion de los motores de camion y tractor.

articles.title: Editado tomo 1 de "Coleccion de anecdotas de Kim Il Sung"
articles.content:
Editado tomo 1 de "Coleccion de anecdotas de Kim Il Sung"
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ACNC) -- Se dio a luz en Corea el tomo 1 de la "Coleccion de anecdotas de Kim Il Sung".
					La coleccion recopila por tomos continuos numerosas anecdotas revolucionarias registradas en la gloriosa vida revolucionaria de mas de 80 anos del Presidente Kim Il Sung dividiendolas por etapas.
					
					Las anecdotas fueron creadas a base de las memorias del Presidente sobre su vida, los contenidos de recordacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il al Presidente y las reminiscencias de los familiares y otros quienes son testigos de las actividades revolucionarias del Presidente.
					
					Contiene ademas los datos que facilitan la compresion de las anecdotas revolucionarias.
					
					El tomo 1 esta dividido por 4 capitulos sobre las anecdotas revolucionarias de la infancia del Presidente desde abril del 1 (1912) hasta junio del 15 (1926) de la Era Juche.
					
					El primer capitulo "Infancia" compila las anecdotas sobre el nacimiento del Presidente y otras de que el mostro la extraordinaria naturaleza llevando la infancia en una familia patriotica y revolucionaria.
					
					El segundo "De un lugar a otro" reune las anecdotas sobre los hechos de que el Presidente se despidio de la patria y llevo su vida en Linjiang y Badaogou.
					
					El tercer "Vida en Escuela Changdok" colecciona las anecdotas que dan a conocer que a la tierna edad de 12 anos el Presidente vino a su tierra natal Mangyongdae y que emprendio la caminata de mil ries para la restauracion tomando la firme decision de no repatriar antes de recuperar la patria.
					
					El cuarto "Fusong" selecciona algunas de las anecdotas que transmiten los hechos de que durante cursaba la Escuela Primaria no. 1 de Fusong, el Presidente gano la fama de activista politico infantil.
					
					Ademas conlleva los contenidos de que el Presidente recibio la idea del "gran proposito", la disposicion a las tres alternativas, la idea de la conquista de camaradas y los dos revolveres como valiosa herencia de su padre y que tomo la firme determinacion de dedicar todo lo suyo por lograr la causa historica de la emancipacion de la patria.
